title: Unable to sync Eth and cannot find recent reference to error
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.11.0-unstable`
 -previously 1.10 when this started
OS & Version: Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS
Commit hash : (if `develop`)

#### Expected behaviour
Syncing to network

#### Actual behaviour
Not advancing Current_block, is advancing "highest_block"
Beacon backfilling failed                err="retrieved hash chain is invalid: missing parent"

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Starting Geth

#### Backtrace

````
akrynite@staker1:~$ sudo systemctl status geth
● geth.service - Go Ethereum Client
     Loaded: loaded (/etc/systemd/system/geth.service; enabled; vendor preset: enabled)
     Active: active (running) since Fri 2022-09-30 14:10:41 UTC; 20min ago
   Main PID: 892 (geth)
      Tasks: 28 (limit: 18758)
     Memory: 7.5G
     CGroup: /system.slice/geth.service
             └─892 /usr/bin/geth --mainnet --http --http.addr 0.0.0.0 --authrpc.addr 0.0.0.0 --authrpc.port 8551 --authrpc.vhosts * --datadir /var/lib/goethereum --authrpc.jwtsecret /var/lib/jwtsecret/jwt.hex

Sep 30 14:30:37 staker1 geth[892]: INFO [09-30|14:30:37.723] Forkchoice requested sync to new head    number=15,646,761 hash=2a0d55..5970cd
Sep 30 14:30:44 staker1 geth[892]: ERROR[09-30|14:30:44.021] Beacon backfilling failed                err="retrieved hash chain is invalid: missing parent"

Sep 30 14:31:00 staker1 geth[892]: INFO [09-30|14:31:00.382] Forkchoice requested sync to new head    number=15,646,763 hash=17ceb6..3925d5
Sep 30 14:31:00 staker1 geth[892]: INFO [09-30|14:31:00.661] Forkchoice requested sync to new head    number=15,646,763 hash=17ceb6..3925d5
Sep 30 14:31:00 staker1 geth[892]: INFO [09-30|14:31:00.818] Downloader queue stats                   receiptTasks=0 blockTasks=13486 itemSize=71.15KiB throttle=3685
````

When submitting logs: please submit them as text and not screenshots.

I have run "geth removedb" and removed ancients.

I updated to 1.11.0-unstable based on suggestions in another forum

This node was previously synced and functioning fine prior to a power outage.

I'm in a similar situation but I'm not getting ```Beacon backfilling failed                err="retrieved hash chain is invalid: missing parent"```

What beacon client are you running? Also I noticed your authrpc is 0.0.0.0, are you running your beacon node on another system?
I run Lighthouse 3.1.2 on a separate system

You might try running with `--vmdodule=downloader=5`, which will raise the log level of the sync code to max, which might point to some issues. You should also please share the logs here so we might investigate (please share a lot of it, not the the end, the issues usually creep up earlier than the failure).
Thank you for your response and advice. I have restarted syncing with that --vmodule=downloader=5. Logs already look different.   I'll post followup when it stops progressing
> hi Akrynite ,your issue is ok ?

I have exactly the same problem. Everything was working fine, but after a power outage 2 days ago, my setup was unable to recover.

I tried the following steps:
- Update GETH and prysm to the latest version
- Remove GETH db with `geth removedb`
- Restarted multiple times

As per @karalabe's suggestion, I turned on `--vmodule=downloader=5`, but it still doesn't work. Here are some logs:

Before adding `--vmodule=downloader=5`

There might be ways to solve this, and there might be ways we can investigate this further - but if you want to use your node as a backend for staking, and thus get it going as soon as possible, my advice would be to do a resync. 

`geth <args> removedb` and answer `y` to `Remove full node state database?` but answer `n` to `Remove full node ancient database ?`. This leaves ancients intact, and saves a few hundred gigs of download. 

Also, we have fixed several issues related to snap-sync on master, so unless you have a very speedy disk, I would recommend running from `master`, a.k.a `latest` on docker and our official downloads.

I may have found the culprit of why the steps @holiman suggested didn't work.

I set up my node based on https://someresat.medium.com/guide-to-staking-on-ethereum-ubuntu-prysm-581fb1969460 (initial version from December 2020). In the guide, the datadir of geth is set to `/var/lib/goethereum`. It seems that if you do `geth removedb`, it will actually delete the chaindata directory of the _default_ location. So you have to do `geth removedb --datadir=/var/lib/goethereum`.

My node is syncing right now, fingers crossed that this was the issue. I'll report back here once syncing is done, hopefully with a positive result.

It took quite a while to sync, but now it works again.

It looks like the power outage somehow corrupted the data, and a re-sync with `removedb` fixed it. Hopefully in the future geth can recover from such corruptions because a re-sync took quite a while.

For anyone running into this issue, please make sure you specify the correct `datadir` when running `removedb` like so: `geth removedb --datadir=/var/lib/goethereum`

In hindsight, one or more of the following was the actual fix, but because I took the "sync cancelled" message literally, I didn't give geth enough time to catch up after each step, so I'm unsure which one or combination was the winner. For anyone facing a similar situation, I can only recommend all of them, but irritatingly the simple removal of the primary db may have been enough, had I given it time.  The steps here are one level of complexity shy of nuking the OS from orbit and wiping the disk, and worked for me: 

1. geth removedb --datadir <your datadir>  --datadir.ancient <your ancient>
2. sudo rm -R /your/datadir
3. sudo rm -R /your/datadir.ancient
4. sudo mkdir /var/lib/newgeth new data dir
5. sudo mkdir /media/ssd/ancient new ancient data dir
6. sudo adduser newgethUser
7. sudo usermod -aG sudo  newgethUser
8. sudo -R chown newgeth:newgeth /both/those/directories
9. edit your /etc/systemd/system/geth.service file to reflect new user and new directories e.g. 

[Unit]
Description=Geth Execution Client (Mainnet)
After=network.target
Wants=network.target
[Service]
User=newgethUser <=== CHANGE THIS
Group=newgethUser <=== CHANGE THIS
Type=simple
Restart=always
RestartSec=5
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/geth \
  --mainnet \
   --datadir /var/lib/yourdatadir \ <=== CHANGE THIS
  --datadir.ancient /media/ssd/yourancient \ <=== CHANGE THIS
  --authrpc.jwtsecret /var/lib/jwtsecret/jwt.hex
[Install]
[WantedBy=default.target](https://wantedby%3Ddefault.target/)

Then do a systemctl daemon-reload and reboot. Just ignore the backfill errors and sync cancelled messages and just let it run.
